{"step_by_step_thinking": "The GNAS-1 gene mutation is associated with a specific condition called fibrous dysplasia. Fibrous dysplasia is a rare bone disorder characterized by the abnormal growth of fibrous tissue in place of normal bone. This condition can affect one bone (monostotic) or multiple bones (polyostotic). The GNAS-1 gene mutation is responsible for activating certain signaling pathways that lead to the development of fibrous dysplasia.", "answer_choice": "A"}
